Evolution¶

Package related to evolutionary agorithms components.

Classes summary¶

Evolution.Population.Population(n_dvar)

Class for the population of an evolutionary algorithm.

Evolution.Mutation.Mutation(prob)

Abstract class for mutation operators.

Class for polynomial mutation.

Abstract class for replacement operators.

Class for custom elitist replacement.

Population¶

class Evolution.Population.Population(n_dvar)¶

Bases: object

Class for the population of an evolutionary algorithm.

Parameters

  • dvec (np.ndarray) – decision vectors of the individuals

  • costs (np.ndarray) – costs associated with each individual

  • fitness_modes (np.ndarray) – evaluation mode associated with each individual: True for simulation (i.e. real evaluation) and False for prediction (i.e. surrogate evaluation)

__init__ method’s input

Parameters

n_dvar (positive int, not zero) – number of decision variables

print_shapes()¶

Prints the shapes of the arrays dvec, costs and fitness_modes forming the population.

check_integrity(pb)¶

Checks arrays’ shapes are consistent.

Parameters

pb (Problem) – the problem the population is associated with

Returns

True for arrays’ consistency and False otherwise

Return type

bool

append(pop)¶

Appends individuals to the current population.

Parameters

pop (Population) – indivials to be appended

sort()¶

Sorts the population according to individuals’ costs (ascending order).

split_in_batches(n_batch)¶

Splits the population in batches.

Parameters

n_batch (positive int, not zero) – number of batches

Returns

list of batches

Return type

list(Population)

update_best_sim(f_best_profile)¶

Updates the best individual and logs.

The best individual is a simulated individual (its fitness_modes is True). The best decision vector (minimisation assumed) is saved in Global_Var.dvec_min. The best cost is saved in Global_Var.cost_min. Both best decision vector and cost are printed to a file.

Parameters

f_best_profile (str) – filename for logging

save_to_csv_file(f_pop_archive, pb)¶

Prints the population to a CSV file.

The CSV file is organized as follows: First row: number of decision variables, number of objectives, number of fitness modes Second row: lower bounds of the decision variables Thrid row: upper bounds of the decision variables Remaining rows (one per individual): decision variables, costs, fitness mode

Parameters

  • f_pop_archive (str) – filename of the CSV file.

  • pb (Problem) – problem the population is assocated with

load_from_csv_file(f_pop_archive, pb)¶

Loads the population from a CSV file.

The CSV file has to be organized as follows: First row: number of decision variables, number of objectives, number of fitness modes Second row: lower bounds of the decision variables Thrid row: upper bounds of the decision variables Remaining rows (one per individual): decision variables, costs, fitness mode

Parameters

  • f_pop_archive (str) – filename of the CSV file

  • pb (Problem) – problem the population is associated with

save_sim_archive(f_sim_archive)¶

Prints the population’s simulated individuals to a CSV file.

The CSV file is organized as follows: One per individual: decision variables, costs, fitness mode.

Parameters

f_sim_archive (str) – filename of the CSV file.

save_to_pickle_file(f_pop_archive, pb)¶

Saves the population to a pickle file.

Parameters

  • f_pop_archive (str) – filename of the pickle file

  • pb (Problem) – problem the population is associated with

load_from_pickle_file(f_pop_archive, pb)¶

Loads a population from a pickle file.

Parameters

  • f_pop_archive (str) – filename of the pickle file

  • pb (Problem) – problem the population is associated with

Tournament_Position¶

class Evolution.Tournament_Position.Tournament_Position(size)¶

Bases: Evolution.Selection.Selection

Class for Tournament_Position selection.

Candidates are ordered within the population according to their promise (decreasing order).

Parameters

size (positive int, not zero) – tournament size

  • n_par (positive int, not zero) – number of individuals to select

the selected individuals

Elitist¶

class Evolution.Elitist.Elitist¶

Bases: Evolution.Replacement.Replacement

Class for Elitist replacement.

Minimization is assumed.

perform_replacement(pop, children)¶

Keeps the best individuals of from two populations.

Parameters

  • pop (Population) – first population, will store the best individuals

  • children (Population) – second population
